channel.title: Item model in wrong position
channel.description: So I want to add the Dragon Platebody and I add the model like usual. I run the server and client, log in and wear the Platebody. But it is in the wrong position. Here is a preview and code I put below. Picture [img]http://img339.imageshack.us/img339/1991/evolved0028.png[/img] Ints:[code]if(i == 15641) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 310; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 1800; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14105;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 14105;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();//examin info }[/code] Item.java: [code]public static int platebody[] = { 14523, 14527, 14531, 14503, 14507, 14538, 14540, 14542, 14544, 14546, 14548, 14550, 14553, 14554, 14555, 14556, 14557, 14531, 14512, 15348, 5032, 5028, 6065, 1844, 5034, 6750, 6617, 5575, 7399, 6322, 6139, 6133, 6129, 7390, 7392, 6916, 1035, 540, 5553, 4757, 1833, 1835, 6388, 6384, 1355, 4111, 4101, 4091, 6186, 6184, 6180, 3058, 4509, 4504, 4069, 4728, 4736, 4712, 6107, 2661, 3140, 1115, 1117, 1119, 1121, 1123, 1125, 1127, 2583, 2591, 2599, 2607, 2615, 2623, 2653, 2669, 3481, 4720, 4728, 4749, 2661, 426, 3387, 7695, 544, 7689, 7660, 7670, 7661, 7669, 7698, 7642, 546, 15641, 14104, 14105 };[/code] (I thought putting up ints is useful) Then I followed this tutorial where in your source folder, you open up item.java. So I opened it and searched for body. I typed in the body section, the item id (15641) Is that the correct number to put up in item.java?

item.title: Item model in wrong position
item.dc:creator: @fil55 fil55
item.description:
@fil55 wrote:

So I want to add the Dragon Platebody and I add the model like usual. I run the server and client, log in and wear the Platebody. But it is in the wrong position. Here is a preview and code I put below.
Picture
Ints:if(i == 15641) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 310; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 1800; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14105;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 14105;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();//examin info }
Item.java: public static int platebody[] = { 14523, 14527, 14531, 14503, 14507, 14538, 14540, 14542, 14544, 14546, 14548, 14550, 14553, 14554, 14555, 14556, 14557, 14531, 14512, 15348, 5032, 5028, 6065, 1844, 5034, 6750, 6617, 5575, 7399, 6322, 6139, 6133, 6129, 7390, 7392, 6916, 1035, 540, 5553, 4757, 1833, 1835, 6388, 6384, 1355, 4111, 4101, 4091, 6186, 6184, 6180, 3058, 4509, 4504, 4069, 4728, 4736, 4712, 6107, 2661, 3140, 1115, 1117, 1119, 1121, 1123, 1125, 1127, 2583, 2591, 2599, 2607, 2615, 2623, 2653, 2669, 3481, 4720, 4728, 4749, 2661, 426, 3387, 7695, 544, 7689, 7660, 7670, 7661, 7669, 7698, 7642, 546, 15641, 14104, 14105 };
(I thought putting up ints is useful)
Then I followed this tutorial where in your source folder, you open up item.java. So I opened it and searched for body. I typed in the body section, the item id (15641) Is that the correct number to put up in item.java?
